metadata.title: LandRisk: A GUI python based software to assess contaminated land risk using Source - Pathway - Receptor setting
metadata.description:
Python-Based Risk Screening System (RSS) for Environmental Risk Assessment

a Python-based Risk Screening System (RSS) designed to perform qualitative environmental risk assessments by evaluating potential contaminant linkages. The system assesses risk based on three fundamental components:

  1. Hazard (Source) – The origin of potential contamination (e.g., chemical spills, industrial waste).

  2. Exposure Pathway – The route through which the hazard propagates to reach a receptor (e.g., soil leaching, groundwater migration, airborne dispersion).

  3. Receptor – The entity that may be adversely affected (e.g., human populations, aquatic ecosystems, wildlife).

Key Applications

Pre-Survey Screening:, serves as an initial qualitative assessment before a walkover survey, helping prioritise areas of concern. It evaluates risk pathways, including:

  • On-site to on-site (internal contamination spread)
  • On-site to off-site (migration beyond property boundaries)
  • Off-site to on-site (external sources impacting the site)

Supports evaluation across different environmental pathways:

  • Soil (e.g., toxic metals, hydrocarbons)
  • Groundwater (e.g., leaching contaminants)
  • Surface water (e.g., runoff contamination)
  • Air (e.g., volatile organic compounds)
  • Sediment (e.g., accumulated contaminants in water bodies)

Risk Scoring Methodology

The RSS calculates risk using a Likelihood × Impact framework, where:

  • Likelihood depends on hazard magnitude and pathway completeness.

  • Impact considers receptor sensitivity and population exposure.

This systematic approach enables rapid risk prioritization, guiding further investigation and remediation planning.

metadata.title: Recycled Politicians and the Development Deficit: A Conceptual Analysis of Liberia's Political Culture
metadata.description: This paper critically examines recycled politicians in Liberia and their impact on the country’s persistent development deficit, situating the discussion within the framework of Liberia’s political culture. Employing conceptual approaches, particularly documentary and content analysis, while upholding the principle of anonymity, the study applies elite theory, political culture theory, and neo-patrimonialism to reveal how entrenched patronage, rent-seeking, and personalistic rules impede development. The analysis underscores the paradox of political recycling as both a survival strategy and a barrier to transformative governance in Liberia. It contends that, although recycled politicians have influenced national development in other African contexts, in Liberia, they have largely perpetuated the development deficit.  Drawing comparative insights from Rwanda, Ghana, and Botswana, the study demonstrates that political recycling, in itself, does not necessarily hinder development when accompanied by a strong political will that ensures accountability and effective resource management. Accordingly, it recommends that Liberia draw on the lessons from these countries to advance its own development trajectory.

journal.title: Global Academic and Scientific Journal of Multidisciplinary Studies (GASJMS)

metadata.title: EDGE LEVEL COMPLEX EVENT PROCESSING AND OPTIMISATION BASED FOG LEVEL LOAD BALANCING MECHANISM IN SOFTWARE DEFINED NETWORK
metadata.description: This study uses an efficient transmission model based on the Hybrid Meta-heuristic Model to enhance data transfer by reducing time complexity. Initially, data is moved into the Complex Event Processing (CEP), which is positioned between the fog layer and the IoT layer. In edge IoT devices, complex event processing comprises real-time analysis, correlation, and interpretation of continuous data streams generated by sensors and edge devices. It seeks to identify significant trends or intricate occurrences in various data streams in order to facilitate quick decisions or immediate reactions. After CEP, a multi-tier priority queue-based model is used to attain priority-aware task scheduling. After the arrival of all the tasks, each task is sorted into slots based on its category. High-priority tasks are completed first due to their preference over lower-priority slots. A software-defined network's optimal resource utilization and task response time are guaranteed by an effective load-balancing method called Hybrid Pigeon Cat Search Optimization Algorithms (HPC_SOA). Arranging tasks based on their availability, capacity, proximity, and energy efficiency may optimize the fog nodes' resource utilization and energy usage. In the evaluation, the proposed approach has consumed 22051 Kw/h of energy.

creators.name: Journal of Theoretical and Applied Information Technology

contributors.name: SARKARSINHA HARSINHA RAJPUT , DR. MANOJ EKNATH PATIL

keywords: Complex Event Processing, Priority Queue Approach, Pigeon Optimization, Cat Search Optimization, Software-Defined Network.

journal.title: Journal of Theoretical and Applied Information Technology

data.title: EDGE LEVEL COMPLEX EVENT PROCESSING AND OPTIMISATION BASED FOG LEVEL LOAD BALANCING MECHANISM IN SOFTWARE DEFINED NETWORK

metadata.title: Job-Crafting and Organizational Commitment: Person-Job Fit as Moderator in Banking Sector of Pakistan
metadata.description: There is intense pressure over organizations to survive in the ever-changing world of competition. Human resource is a prime factor that has no alternative and substitute. Success of any organization is highly dependent upon quality of human resource. This study investigates inter play of job crafting , organizational commitment and moderating role of person-job fit in banking sector of Pakistan..200 questionnaires were floated at email addresses of employees working at branch level of bank. Response rate in this study is 84%.Regression analyses and Andrew Hayes Technique of moderation has been used to perform data analysis. There is significant impact of job crafting over organizational commitment of employees. Person-Job Fit is playing its role as moderator with job crafting and organizational commitment.it is of high significance that with increasing value of person-job fit, its moderating impact decreases.

creators.name: Iqbal, Qaisar
creators.affiliation: Branch Banking, MCB Bank Ltd, Attock, Pakistan

journal.title: International Journal of Management, Accounting and Economics

data.title: Job-Crafting and Organizational Commitment: Person-Job Fit as Moderator in Banking Sector of Pakistan

metadata.title: A Gender-Based Approach: Service Quality and Customer's Loyalty
metadata.description: This study explores moderating role of branch managers as gender on the service quality and customer’s loyalty in Private Banks of Pakistan. This study seeks additional insights through comparison of the strength of influence of gender as male and female. Data was collected using convenient sampling technique from 175 respondents of two large private banks through self-administered questionnaire. Statistical software package for social sciences was employed for data analysis Regression analysis and Andrew Hayes methodology of moderation has been used to analyze data. Response rate in this study was 87.50%.there is significant relationship of service quality with customer’s loyalty. Gender moderates the association of service quality and customer’s loyalty. But, impact of male gender is higher than female as moderator on relationship of service quality and customer’s loyalty. Male branch managers moderate the association of service quality and customer’s loyalty. There is non-significant impact of female branch managers on the relationship of service quality and customer’s loyalty. This study will help the management of banks to assess and improve level of service quality in retail banking in order to retain existing customers, grasp new customers and enhance their loyalty.

creators.name: Iqbal, Qaisar

metadata.title: Role of Workplace Spirituality: Personality Traits and Counterproductive Workplace Behaviors in Banking Sector
metadata.description: This research has examined moderating role of workplace spirituality with five traits of personality and counterproductive work behaviors. Researchers have growing trend to enhance understanding of workplace spirituality. Corporate environment has also realized significance of workplace spirituality. Self-structured questionnaire have been employed to collect data from employees of private commercial banks, operating in jurisdiction of Distt. Attock, Pakistan. Response rate in this study is 82%.Data was analyzed on the basis of moderating concept of Baron and Kenny (1986) in statistical software for social sciences. This study concludes that workplace spirituality has significant moderating impact over the association of openness, conscientiousness and agreeableness with counterproductive work behaviors.it has been also revealed that there is no relationship between extroversion and counterproductive work behaviors. Workplace spirituality has no moderating impact over association of neuroticism and extroversion with counterproductive work behaviors of employees. This study develops ways for management and practitioners to alleviate the effects of personality traits on counterproductive work behaviors and reduce the occurrences of counterproductive work behaviors. Ultimately it will improve organizational performance.

creators.name: Hasnah Hassan, Siti
creators.affiliation: Management Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Penang, Malaysia

journal.title: International Journal of Management, Accounting and Economics

data.title: Role of Workplace Spirituality: Personality Traits and Counterproductive Workplace Behaviors in Banking Sector

metadata.title: Where the money went: Six Decades of Donor Agricultural Finance and Policy Lessons from Cameroon.
metadata.description:
This dataset provides project-level information on 80 agricultural and rural development programs implemented in Cameroon between 1960 and 2025, compiled from multilateral and bilateral donor reports, national budget documents, and completion evaluations. It underpins the study “Where the Money Went: Six Decades of Donor Agricultural Finance and Policy Lessons from Cameroon.”

Each observation represents one donor-funded project, including metadata on financial scale, donor type, sectoral focus, spatial coverage, and implementation duration. The dataset integrates both financial and descriptive variables to support empirical analyses of aid efficiency, fragmentation, and execution ratios.

creators.name: Lufung, Lewis Ngwale
creators.affiliation: AgriDynamic Research and Innovation Institute Cameroon

creators.name: Fuekang, Melvis Kifeh
creators.affiliation: AgriDynamic Research and Innovation Institute Cameroon

metadata.title: Determinantes del aumento de la incidencia VIH
metadata.description: Tesis de Fin de "Master en Infección por VIH" de la Universidad Rey Juan Carlos de España. El tutor: Talía Sainz, Pediatra. Directora del Master: Dra. Rosa Polo. Estudio observacional retrospectivo de serie de casos. El objetivo General fue determinar los factores de riesgo relacionados con el aumento de la incidencia de casos reportados de VIH entre 2012 y 2024 en Cali, Colombia. Se utilizó análisis multivariado mediante regresión de Poisson. Se analizaron 16054 casos, de SIVIGILA. Software R v.4.31.

creators.name: ROJAS PALACIOS, JORGE HUMBERTO
creators.affiliation: Ministerio de Salud y Proteccion Social de Colombia

metadata.title: Integrating Agricultural Literacy Into Social Studies Curriculum: A Design-Based Approach For Sustainable Education In Rural Indonesia
metadata.description:
AGRICULTURAL LITERACY INTEGRATION INTO SOCIAL STUDIES CURRICULUM:

DESIGN-BASED RESEARCH DATA FROM INDRAMAYU REGENCY, INDONESIA

 

RESEARCH OVERVIEW:

This comprehensive dataset contains qualitative and quantitative research data from a design-based research (DBR) study on integrating agricultural literacy into junior secondary Social Studies (IPS) curriculum in Indramayu Regency, West Java, Indonesia.

 

Research Study: "Integrating Agricultural Literacy Into Social Studies Curriculum: A Design-Based Approach For Sustainable Education In Rural Indonesia"

 

Authors: Syahrul Bachtiar & Rusman

Affiliation: Universitas Pendidikan Indonesia (UPI), Department of Curriculum Development

 

DATASET CONTENTS:

 

1. PHASE 1 - NEEDS ANALYSIS DATA

   - Semi-structured interview transcript with 1 MGMP representative (11 main questions; 20 sub-questions)

   - Teacher questionnaire responses: N=306 Social Studies teachers

   - 21-item competency assessment questionnaire (Cronbach's α = 0.934)

   - Document analysis: curriculum syllabi and teaching materials review

   - Key findings: 82% teachers recognize agricultural literacy relevance; 70% lack curricular resources

 

2. PHASE 2 - CURRICULUM DESIGN & VALIDATION

   - Expert curriculum validation data from 3 validators

   - Curriculum design framework and development process

   - Validation scores: Mean 3.81/4.0 (95.2% validity rate)

   - 21 curriculum components evaluated across 3 expert validators

 

3. PHASE 3 - IMPLEMENTATION DATA

   - Semi-structured interview transcripts with 4 Social Studies teachers (G1, G2, G3, G4)

   - Teacher questionnaire responses: 20-item evaluation (N=4)

   - Teacher satisfaction: 298/320 items (93.1%)

   - Student engagement data (N=80 students)

   - Pre-post knowledge assessment results

   - Achievement gains and learning outcome measurements

 

RESEARCH SETTING:

Indramayu Regency, West Java, Indonesia—a major rice-producing region characterized by:

- Extensive agricultural land (predominately rice cultivation)

- Young farmer population decline crisis (63% youth uninterested in agriculture)

- Strong agrarian traditions but limited youth engagement

- Ideal context for studying contextual agricultural literacy integration

 

RESEARCH METHODOLOGY:

Design-Based Research approach across three phases:

- Phase 1: Needs analysis through interviews and questionnaires

- Phase 2: Curriculum design and expert validation

- Phase 3: Implementation with classroom trials and student learning assessment

 

DATA CHARACTERISTICS:

- Language: English (questionnaire items and interview transcripts translated from Indonesian)

- Participants: 306 teachers (Phase 1); 4 teachers (Phase 3); 80 students (Phase 3)

- Data types: Interview transcripts, questionnaire responses, assessment data, validation rubrics

- Instruments: Semi-structured interview protocols, 21-item questionnaire, student engagement scales, pre-post knowledge tests

- Time frame: 2024-2025

 

KEY FINDINGS SUMMARY:

- Teacher Recognition: 82% recognize agricultural literacy as highly relevant to Social Studies

- Resource Gap: 70% teachers report lacking curricular resources for implementation

- Student Engagement: 85% reported lessons as highly relevant (Phase 3)

- Knowledge Gains: 18.3% mean improvement pre-post (Cohen's d = 1.21, large effect)

- Attitudinal Change: 100% of students reported increased respect for farmers

- Career Interest: 42% showed increased interest in agricultural careers

- Teacher Satisfaction: 93.1% rated curriculum implementation very positively

- Curriculum Validation: 95.2% validity rate from expert validators

 

RESEARCH ETHICS:

- Ethical Approval: Universitas Pendidikan Indonesia Research Ethics Committee (Approval No. B-5093/UN40.A1.1/TD.07/2025)

- Informed Consent: All participants provided informed consent prior to data collection

- Confidentiality: Participant data anonymized; identifying information removed

- Voluntary Participation: All participants informed of voluntary nature and right to withdraw

 

DATASET FILES INCLUDED:

1. Interview_Transcript_Teachers.docx - Teacher interview transcripts (Phase 1 & 3)

2. Needs-Analysis.xlsx - Complete questionnaire data from 306 teachers with statistical summaries

3. Implementation-Results.xlsx - Teacher (N=4) and student (N=80) evaluation data with pre-post assessment results

4. Expert-curriculum-validation.xlsx - Expert validator ratings and curriculum validation data

 

USE CASES:

This dataset is valuable for:

- Understanding teacher and student perspectives on agricultural literacy integration

- Examining contextual curriculum design in rural agricultural regions

- Studying design-based research implementation in Indonesian educational contexts

- Supporting evidence-based arguments for agricultural education in Social Studies

- Informing international curriculum development efforts in sustainable education

- Contributing to research on youth engagement with agriculture and food systems

 

STATISTICAL INFORMATION:

- Teacher questionnaire: Cronbach's α = 0.934 (excellent internal consistency)

- Knowledge assessment: t(79) = 17.79, p < 0.001 (highly significant improvement)

- Expert validation: Mean 3.81/4.0; SD = 0.43; 95.2% validity

- Student engagement ratings: Mean 3.83/4.0 on 18-item scale

- Teacher implementation satisfaction: 93.1% (298/320 items scored favorably)

 

CITATION FORMAT (APA 7th Edition):

Bachtiar, S., & Rusman. (2025). Interview transcripts and research data: Agricultural literacy integration into social studies curriculum—Indramayu Regency, Indonesia [Data set]. Zenodo. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.17500112

 

ATTRIBUTION:

Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC-BY 4.0)

 

RELATED PUBLICATIONS:

Bachtiar, S., & Rusman. (2025). Integrating agricultural literacy into social studies curriculum: A design-based research approach for sustainable education in rural Indonesia. [Journal article submitted/pending]

 

CONTACT:

For inquiries regarding this dataset, please contact: syahrulbachtiar@upi.edu
